name: fall horizons throw blanket
notes:
*the pattern is free to view in full on the blog through the link here on ravelry. there is also an [ad-free, printable version available to purchase on etsy here.][1]
have fun!

seven rich colors, squishy, cozy texture and beautiful patterning come together to create this easy knit throw.  the ultimate fall and winter blanket, it’s made for curling up by the fire! the super simple repeat makes for a fun knit and it’s beginner friendly. a quick knit, this blanket work up like a dream with chunky yarn and big needles.  perfect to drape over your couch season after season.

materials: 
7 different colors of lion brand hue + me chunky #5 yarn 
	each skein contains 137 yds and 125 g
us size 15, 36” circular needles
scissors
tapestry needle 
measuring tape

size (approximate):
40” x 47” there is info in the pattern notes on how to easily adjust the size!
           

this easy pattern uses a three row repeat.  you will only need to know how to knit, yarn over, and knit two together.  choose your seven colors and simply work through each skein of yarn in the order you prefer. 

you can certainly make this in a solid color as well.  have fun!


  [1]: https://www.etsy.com/listing/1770726304/fall-blanket-knitting-pattern-wavy-knit
